Root.title: Critical Care Nurse Practitioner
Root.description:
Transform patient care and the community as a Nocturnist Critical Care Nurse Practitioner in Austin, TX!

Our mission in Austin is to provide “better” in every sense—better healthcare, better teamwork, and a lasting impact on the community we proudly serve. Ready to grow your career in a place that values community and collaboration? Let’s talk.

We are hiring for a Nocturnist position. A Nocturnist role requires working exclusively overnight shifts.

People First in Austin

Local Team Collaboration:

  • St. David’s North Austin Medical Center is a 440-bed acute care facility and Level IV trauma center offering excellent women’s health services, a heart and vascular center, neurology and neurosurgery programs, and a kidney transplant program. Roughly 1/3 of all deliveries in Austin happen at our hospital.
  • The APP averages 1-2 admissions overnight, plus procedures. We respond to codes along with the ER Physician. We do not participate in rapid response. This is a collegial team to work with and we have excellent rapport with the Hospitalist, ER Team, and specialists.

Qualifications:

  • Graduate degree from an accredited Acute Care Nurse Practitioner program.
  • Active Nurse Practitioner license or eligible to become licensed in Texas.
  • Must be proficient in performing ICU procedures (arterial lines and central lines).
  • 2 years of ICU experience in the scope of an ACNP-BC.
Practice in the Heart of the Community

Scheduling:

  • flexible block schedule to meet team members' needs.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Providing care to patients in the ICU.
  • Admit patients to the ICU and perform procedures.

Living and Working in Austin:

  • Named the Live Music Capital of the World, Austin has a plethora of music venues and local bands to entertain endless crowds. The metro area is home to banner music festivals like Austin City Limits, a two-weekend-long fall event featuring major headliners and lesser-known acts, as well as South by Southwest. Those who are looking for a great dining experience will enjoy Austin’s bustling culinary scene, featuring an endless array of BBQ and food trucks, as well as fine dining restaurants. Outdoor amenities are endless – spend the day on Town Lake, or cool off Located inside off at Barton Springs is a natural pool fed by underwater springs. A booming job market and excellent schools make Austin a wonderful place for families.
Purpose-Driven Work with Local Impact

Austin-Centered Care:

Our guiding principle is patient-first care, which means we focus on the people of Austin and nearby areas. You’ll be part of a team that’s making a real difference in the health of our neighbors.

Rewards and Benefits:

  • Compenseation: Competitive salary
  • Benefits:
    • Comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, and life insurance.
    • 401k with matching contributions.
    • Paid malpractice, including tail coverage.

Root.title: Intensivist
Root.description:
Transform patient care and the community as a Critical Care Physician in Long Beach, CA!

Our mission in Long Beach is to provide “better” in every sense—better healthcare, better teamwork, and a lasting impact on the community we proudly serve. Ready to grow your career in a place that values community and collaboration? Let’s talk.

People First in Long Beach

Local Team Collaboration:

  • Long Beach Memorial Medical Center is a 420-bed non-profit teaching hospital that has been recognized as a major regional provider of medical and surgical services by US News and World Report.
  • Intensivists will rotate through both Med/Surg ICU and CVICU (depending on need).
  • 15-bed CVICU (non-teaching service)
  • 32-bed Med/Surg ICU, which is the teaching service with Internal Medicine residents and Pulmonary/Critical Care Fellows.
  • EMR: Cerner with Dragon for dictation

Qualifications:

  • Board-certified or board-eligible critical care physicians (MD or DO).
  • A commitment to excellence in clinical service, with strong problem-solving abilities essential for the ICU setting.
  • An active California medical license is preferred.
Practice in the Heart of the Community

Scheduling:

  • This position is part-time and works on a 7-on, 7-off schedule, with one week of days per month.

Key Responsibilities:

  • This is an ideal environment for someone wanting to care for the full spectrum of critically ill patients.
  • Opportunity to teach residents and fellows at the bedside.

Living and Working in Long Beach:

Long Beach is a beautiful, vibrant beachfront community located ½ hour from Los Angeles. Numerous unique dining and shopping destinations are mixed with eclectic neighborhoods, arts and culture, history, family-friendly activities, and endless sports and recreation opportunities in this urban waterfront playground. Enjoy a live performance at the Long Beach Performing Arts Center, home to the Long Beach Symphony Orchestra, or enjoy a fun family day at the Long Beach Aquarium. Catalina Island, Disneyland, and Universal Studios Hollywood are all a short car ride away.

Purpose-Driven Work with Local Impact

Long Beach-Centered Care:

Our guiding principle is patient-first care, which means we focus on the people of Long Beach and nearby areas. You’ll be part of a team that’s making a real difference in the health of our neighbors.

Rewards and Benefits:

  • Compensation: Annual part-time comp is $202,517
  • Benefits:
    • Comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, and life insurance.

Root.title: Emergency Medicine Medical Director - Ambassador Travel Team
Root.description:
Discover your next career destination as a Medical Director-Ambassador Travel Team at Sound

At Sound, we strive to deliver “better” to our community—better care, better collaboration, and a heartfelt dedication to those we serve. Let's start a conversation if you’re seeking a role that fosters professional growth and community connection.

People First at Sound

Local Team Collaboration:

  • Join our team of elite travel emergency medicine physicians and APPs where excellence in medical practice is a shared commitment.
  • Our group brings together professionals from all over the USA, creating a rich collaborative environment.

Qualifications:

  • Board-certified/eligible in emergency or family medicine with emergency medicine experience.
  • ABEM or AOBEM eligible/certified
Practice in the Heart of the Community

Flexible Scheduling:

  • Enjoy the convenience of block scheduling, allowing for a better work-life balance.
  • Shift Lengths vary between 8-12 hours.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Benefit from flexible administrative positions that cater to individual preferences and career goals.
  • Collaborate with fellow clinicians, taking on leadership opportunities to develop new team models and mentor new team members.
  • Participate in team meetings and initiatives, driving high-quality care and advancing our mission to improve bedside care.

Living and Working at Sound:

  • Our flexible scheduling, which focuses on family and the outdoors, supports a healthy work-life balance and encourages mutual support among colleagues.
Purpose-Driven Work with Local Impact

Community-Centered Care:

  • Patient care is our top priority.
  • We strongly emphasize growth and development, which enables our team members to expand their careers locally and within the broader medical group.

Rewards and Benefits:

  • Compensation: Comprehensive rewards with W2 compensation at $325 per hour and a $124,800 stipend.
  • Benefits:
    • Comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, and life insurance.
    • Covered travel expenses.
    • Covered license fees.
    • 401k with matching contributions.
    • Paid malpractice insurance with lifetime tail coverage.
    • Annual CME allowance.

Root.title: Medical Director of Advisory Services
Root.description:
Join Our FHM Memorial Hospital Team as a Medical Director of Advisory Services – A Role Designed for You

At FHN Memorial Hospital, we are dedicated to improving the care of our local community. If you're looking for a role that supports professional growth while directly impacting the health of the people we serve, we’d love to talk. Join a team where your expertise in utilization management, compliance, and clinical documentation will help shape the future of healthcare in this region.

People First at FHN Memorial Hospital

Local Team Collaboration

  • FHM Memorial Hospital has 100 staffed beds and is affiliated with the Family Health Centers Health network, which sees over 575,000 patients annually.
  • Join our nationwide Physician Advisory team, which includes 23 onsite physician advisors employed by Sound and 39 onsite physician advisors directly employed by the hospitals we support. Together, they collaborate to provide expert guidance and drive better outcomes.
  • Our physician advisory team operates across multiple states, including Arizona, California, Florida, Kentucky, Nevada, and West Virginia, collaborating with partner hospitals to improve services and outcomes.
  • The team leads utilization management (UM) efforts, clinical documentation improvement (CDI), and regulatory compliance. Our role is to drive hospital performance improvement, such as length of stay, readmissions, and enhanced documentation.

Qualifications

  • Board certification is required.
  • Experience in utilization management, compliance, or clinical documentation improvement preferred.
  • Strong leadership, education, and collaboration skills.
Practice in the Heart of the Community 

Flexible Scheduling

  • Our standard schedule is Monday through Friday, with no evening calls or weekend shifts, providing a healthy work-life balance that supports both our team and the community.
  • This hybrid position offers the opportunity to work on-site weekly, with the flexibility to work remotely on select days.

Key Responsibilities

  • As a Physician Advisor, you'll lead efforts to improve regulatory compliance, documentation, and utilization of hospital resources.
  • Collaborate closely with case management, clinical documentation improvement, and revenue cycle leadership teams to identify and address performance improvement opportunities.
  • Provide one-on-one and group education to medical staff and support efforts to reduce payer denials.
  • Offer timely and effective consultations to physicians, hospital staff, and coding specialists.

Living and working in Freeport, Illinois

  • Freeport, Illinois, is a commutable distance to Chicago, IL, and is considered a good place to live, offering a mix of small-town charms and amenities. The city provides a lower cost of living, good schools, and a safe environment. It is particularly appealing for families and those seeking a less hectic pace of life with access to nearby metropolitan areas.
Purpose-Driven Work with Local Impact 

FHN Memorial Hospital-Centered Care:

  • Our focus is always on putting patients first and ensuring that we enhance the quality of care for the people of Freeport and the surrounding areas. As a Physician Advisor, you’ll help improve patient outcomes and streamline processes to benefit the entire community.

Rewards and Benefits: 

  • Compensation: Competitive salary commensurate with experience.
  • Benefits:
    • Comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, and life insurance.
    • 401(k) with matching contributions and paid malpractice insurance.
    • Annual CME allowance and PTO.

Root.title: Anesthesiologist
Root.description:
Join Our Phoenix, Arizona, Team as an Anesthesiologist– A Role Designed for You

We believe in bringing "better" to our local community in Phoenix—better care, better collaboration, and a deep commitment to the people we serve. We'd love to talk if you're looking for a role that supports your professional growth and connection to a vibrant community.

People First in Phoenix

Local Team Collaboration:

  • Join our close-knit team of 16 physicians and 39 CRNAs at Banner University Medical Center.
  • Work alongside other highly motivated anesthesiologists in a strong care team model style practice.
  • We foster close collaboration with our surgical and perioperative colleagues, ensuring we collectively provide the highest standard of anesthesia care for the Phoenix community.

Qualifications:

  • Board-certified/eligible in anesthesia.
  • Great opportunity for experienced Anesthesiologists or individuals just starting their careers.
  • New graduates, residents, and fellows are welcome to apply.
Practice in the Heart of the Community

Flexible Scheduling:

  • 44 weeks a year average of 50 hours a week, 8 Weeks PTO
  • Our team boasts high retention rates, with collaborative efforts to ensure coverage during time off.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Physicians act in a supervisory role but enjoy a good amount of clinical work performed independently.
  • Banner University Medical Center is a nationally recognized, 733-bed academic Level I Trauma Center and one of Arizona’s leading hospitals.

Living and Working in Phoenix:

  • Phoenix is where the sun never stops shining, and the stunning desert landscape matches the city’s energy. As Arizona’s capital, Phoenix offers a bustling urban vibe alongside easy access to nature’s beauty. Whether enjoying the vibrant arts scene, exploring hiking trails, or experiencing a diverse food culture, Phoenix offers something for everyone in this southwestern oasis.
Purpose-Driven Work with Local Impact

Phoenix-Centered Care:

  • Our guiding principle is patient-first care, which means we’re focused on the people of Phoenix and nearby areas. You’ll be part of a team that’s making a real difference in the health of our neighbors.
  • We take pride in our community-minded approach, actively encouraging team members to contribute to community health and wellness within and outside the hospital.
  • We have a talented group of mostly fellowship-trained physicians and some of the strongest CRNAs in the Valley.

Rewards and Benefits:

  • Compensation:
    • 44 weeks a year- $425k for W2 or $442k for 1099
    • Sign-on bonus and quality bonus available
  • Benefits:
    • Comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, and life insurance.
    • 401k with matching contributions.
    • Paid malpractice insurance with tail coverage.
    • 8 weeks of scheduled time off annually.
    • Annual CME allowance.

Root.title: Nocturnist Nurse Practitioner
Root.description:
Join Our Lexington, Kentucky Team as a Nocturnist Acute Care Nurse Practitioner – A Role Designed for You

Our mission in Lexington is to provide “better” in every sense—better healthcare, better teamwork, and a lasting impact on the community we proudly serve. Ready to grow your career in a place that values community and collaboration? Let’s talk.

We are hiring for a Nocturnist Nurse Practitioner position. A Nocturnist role requires working exclusively overnight shifts. Candidates must be comfortable with a nocturnal schedule and possess the ability to deliver exceptional patient care during nighttime hours.

People First in Lexington

Local Team Collaboration:

  • Become a part of a cohesive and established team of 20 physicians and six advanced practice providers (APPs), supported by two clinical performance nurses at St. Joseph Hospital.
  • Work alongside a culturally diverse team with a balanced mix of experienced providers and new graduates.
  • Collaborate closely with hospital administration, participating in committees and projects to improve hospital operations and patient care.
  • Enjoy a supportive work environment with regular touch bases and social gatherings outside the hospital to foster team cohesion.

Qualifications:

  • Board-certified/eligible nurse practitioner.
Practice in the Heart of the Community

Flexible Scheduling:

  • Enjoy a flexible schedule that balances work and personal life. Most prioritize family or outdoor time and support each other by covering shifts when needed.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Manage complex cases in a semi-open ICU with 24-hour intensivist coverage.
  • Perform procedures as per your privileges (procedures are not required).
  • Participate in team huddles at least three times a week and a monthly all-staff meeting to stay connected with practice updates, hospital-related topics, and developments within Sound Physicians.
  • Attend monthly educational CME meetings and hospital-wide hospital medicine committee meetings.
  • Collaborate with Hospitalist APPs, who independently manage pre-op patients in a clinical setting, with support from supervising physicians and staff.

Living and Working in Lexington:

  • Lexington, Kentucky, offers a charming blend of Southern hospitality and a vibrant cultural scene, making it an inviting place to call home. Known for its picturesque horse farms and rich history, moving to Lexington provides an opportunity to embrace a unique combination of tradition and modern living.
Purpose-Driven Work with Local Impact

Lexington-Centered Care:

  • At Sound Physicians, our guiding principle is simple: we always put patients first. This patient-centered approach drives our commitment to providing the highest-quality care to those we serve.
  • As a community-minded team, we actively contribute to making Lexington thrive within the hospital and our local neighborhoods. We prioritize growth and development, encouraging teammates to expand their careers locally or within our broader medical group and fostering professional and community impact.

Rewards and Benefits:

  • Compensation: Competitive compensation package with additional bonuses.
  • Benefits:
    • Comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, life, and AD&D insurance.
    • Long- and short-term disability coverage.
    • 401(k) with matching contributions.
    • Paid medical malpractice insurance with tail coverage.
    • Annual CME allowance to support ongoing education.
    • Generous paid time off to ensure work-life balance.

Root.title: Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetist (CRNA)
Root.description:
Join Our Team at Princeton Community Hospital as a CRNA – A Role Designed for You!

We believe in bringing “better” to our local community in Princeton, West Virginia—better care, better collaboration, and a deep commitment to the people we serve. We'd love to talk if you’re looking for a role that supports your professional growth and connection to a vibrant community.

People First in Princeton

Local Team Collaboration:

  • Join our close-knit team of 5 physicians and 13 CRNAs at Princeton Community Hospital.
  • Work in a collaborative, collegial environment that emphasizes mutual support and learning from one another.

Qualifications:

  • Board-certified Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetist (CRNA)
  • New graduates are welcome to apply. Completion of training, board certification, and an unrestricted APRN license to be granted before the start of employment
  • Interest in practicing at the top of your license in a supportive, team-based setting.
Practice in the Heart of the Community

Flexible Scheduling:

  • Full-time opportunity.
  • Home call is evenly divided among the team – average is 1:12.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Manage general, orthopedic, OB/GYN, podiatry, ENT, urology, and endoscopy cases.
  • Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team in a family-like culture where camaraderie is key.

Living and Working in Princeton:

  • Princeton offers breathtaking views of the Appalachian Mountains, various outdoor activities, and a community-oriented lifestyle.
  • The town’s focus on green spaces and healthy living makes it an ideal location for nature lovers.
Purpose-Driven Work with Local Impact

Princeton-Centered Care:

Our guiding principle is patient-first care, ensuring we focus on the health and well-being of the people in Princeton and the surrounding 10-county region. Join a team making a meaningful difference in the lives of our neighbors.

Rewards and Benefits:

  • Compensation:
    • $75,000 SUMMER SIGN-ON BONUS
    • Salary ranging from $300,000 to $330,000 (W2 and 1099 options).
    • Minimum additional call pay of $15,600.
  • Extra Work Compensation Details:
    • Extra Shift Daily Rate $200/hr guaranteed
    • Extra Weekday Call Shift - $450
    • Extra Weekend Call Shift - $675
    • 2-hour guaranteed call-back rate per shift
  • Benefits:
    • Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life, and AD&D insurance, long- and short-term disability coverage.
    • 401k with matching contributions.
    • Paid malpractice insurance, including tail coverage.
    • Generous eight weeks of paid time off annually.
    • Annual CME allowance.
    • Leadership opportunities
    • Additional perks: Strong commencement bonus and leadership opportunities.

Root.title: Emergency Medicine Physician Assistant
Root.description:
Join Our Bronx, New York Team as an Emergency Medicine Physician Assistant – A Role Designed for You

Our mission in the Bronx is to provide “better” in every sense—better healthcare, better teamwork, and a lasting impact on the community we proudly serve. Ready to grow your career in a place that values community and collaboration? Let’s talk.

People First in the Bronx

Local Team Collaboration:

  • Join our close-knit team of eight physicians and seven APPs at Montefiore Westchester Square with strong PA leadership.
  • We maintain strong connections through team meetings bi-monthly
  • We operate between Mount Vernon and Westchester Square sites

Qualifications:

  • Board-certified/eligible physician assistants.
  • Emergency medicine experience preferred.
  • 2025 grads are encouraged to apply.
Practice in the Heart of the Community

Flexible Scheduling:

  • Single-physician coverage ensures a focused and independent approach to medical decision-making and treatment provision.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Our Montefiore site is New York’s first free-standing emergency department
  • Cater to a diverse population with a low-volume ED with a high acuity directly, providing a dynamic and challenging

Living and Working in the Bronx:

  • The Bronx isn’t just where we work—it’s where we live, thrive, and experience the energy of New York City. With its rich cultural diversity, beautiful parks, iconic landmarks, and vibrant neighborhoods, the Bronx offers a unique blend of urban excitement and community warmth. It’s where opportunity and connection come together, making it a great place to call home.
Purpose-Driven Work with Local Impact

Bronx-Centered Care:

  • Our guiding principle is patient-first care, which means we’re focused on the people of the Bronx and nearby areas. You’ll be part of a team that’s making a real difference in the health of our neighbors.

Rewards and Benefits:

  • Compensation: Expected annual compensation is $124-144K.
  • Benefits:
    • Comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, and life insurance.
    • 401k with matching contributions.
    • Paid malpractice insurance with tail coverage.
    • Annual CME allowance.

Root.title: Hospital Medicine Physician
Root.description:
Join our team as a Hospital Medicine Physician in Plainview, Texas, and lead the way in patient care. 

Our mission in Plainview is to provide “better” in every sense—better healthcare, better teamwork, and a lasting impact on the community we proudly serve. Ready to grow your career in a place that values community and collaboration? Let’s talk.

People First in Lubbock

Local Team Collaboration:

  • Join our well-established team of 2 MDs and 2 night APPs at Covenant Plainview Medical Center.
  • Work alongside our dedicated providers, committed to providing patient-centered care in collaboration with all stakeholders in a positive manner.
  • We promote a caring environment, value each other’s well-being, and seamlessly collaborate across hospital departments to achieve shared objectives.

Qualifications:

  • The candidate must be board-certified/eligible in IM or FM.
  • We accept both internal medicine and family medicine trained physicians. Hospitalist experience is preferred, but new grads are welcome to apply.
  • ACLS certification is mandatory.
  • Candidates must be authorized to work in the United States.
Practice in the Heart of the Community

Scheduling:

  • 7 days on, 7 days off.
  • Open day hospitalist position shift is 7 am-7 pm, and you will be on call during your shift rotation. You will not need to go back into the hospital.
  • Nights are covered by an APP. We manage both the Hospitalist and Emergency Medicine departments.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Provide high-quality, comprehensive medical care and post-operative care to a 49-bed hospital.
  • Central lines and Intubation are mandatory. ER responds to codes. You will run rapids on your patient.
  • Utilize EPIC EMR systems and Sound’s internal informatics platform.

Living and Working in Lubbock:

  • Lubbock is more than just where we work—it’s where we live and experience the heart of West Texas.
  • With its lively culture, vibrant arts scene, and strong agricultural heritage, Lubbock offers a unique blend of modern living and traditional Texas charm.
  • Whether you’re enjoying a local festival, exploring the outdoors, or connecting with friends and family, Lubbock is a place where you can truly feel at home.
Purpose-Driven Work with Local Impact

Lubbock-Centered Care:

  • Many team members serve on various committees, including the medical executive, utilization management, quality review, sepsis, and stroke.
  • Some providers are preceptors for internal medicine residents from Texas Tech University in Lubbock.
  • We regularly gather monetary donations to support a local children’s home.
  • We handle a significant influx of patients from Eastern New Mexico and rural Texas, collaborating closely with case management to overcome unique socioeconomic challenges and ensure comprehensive care beyond the acute setting.
  • We operate as a well-organized team with updated systems, teaching tools, and educational programs provided by Sound, all while prioritizing patient well-being and supporting career advancement opportunities within the medical group.

Rewards and Benefits:

  • Compensation: Hourly compensation for day shift is $2000; daytime rounder base salary is $365,000.
    • Robust sign-on bonus and RVU & quality bonuses offered.
  • Benefits:
    • Comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, and life insurance.
    • 401k with matching contributions.
    • Paid malpractice insurance with tail coverage.
    • Annual CME allowance.
    • Professional development opportunities.

Root.title: Hospital Medicine Physician Assistant
Root.description:
Join Our Lexington, Kentucky Team as a Nocturnist Physician Assistant – A Role Designed for You

We believe in bringing "better" to our local community in Lexington—better care, better collaboration, and a deep commitment to the people we serve. If you're looking for a role that supports your professional growth and your connection to a vibrant community, we’d love to talk.

We are hiring for a Nocturnist APP position. A Nocturnist role requires working exclusively overnight shifts. Candidates must be comfortable with a nocturnal schedule and possess the ability to deliver exceptional patient care during nighttime hours.

People First in Lexington

Local Team Collaboration:

  • Join our close-knit, established team of 20 physicians and six advanced practice providers (APPs), supported by two clinical performance nurses at St. Joseph Hospital.
  • Work alongside a culturally diverse team with a balanced mix of experienced providers and new graduates.
  • Collaborate closely with hospital administration, participating in committees and projects to improve hospital operations and patient care.
  • Enjoy a supportive work environment with regular touch bases and social gatherings outside the hospital to foster team cohesion.

Qualifications:

  • Physician assistant board certification is required.
Practice in the Heart of the Community

Flexible Scheduling:

  • Enjoy a flexible schedule that balances work and personal life. Most prioritize family or outdoor time and support each other by covering shifts when needed.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Manage complex cases in a semi-open ICU with 24-hour intensivist coverage.
  • Perform procedures as per your privileges (procedures are not required).
  • Participate in team huddles at least three times a week and a monthly all-staff meeting to stay connected with practice updates, hospital-related topics, and developments within Sound Physicians.
  • Attend monthly educational CME meetings and hospital-wide hospital medicine committee meetings.
  • Collaborate with Hospitalist APPs, who independently manage pre-op patients in a clinical setting, with support from supervising physicians and staff.

Living and Working in Lexington:

  • Lexington, Kentucky, offers a charming blend of Southern hospitality and a vibrant cultural scene, making it an inviting place to call home. Known for its picturesque horse farms and rich history, moving to Lexington provides an opportunity to embrace a unique combination of tradition and modern living.
Purpose-Driven Work with Local Impact

Lexington-Centered Care:

  • At Sound Physicians, our guiding principle is simple: we always put patients first. This patient-centered approach drives our commitment to providing the highest-quality care to those we serve.
  • As a community-minded team, we actively contribute to making Lexington thrive within the hospital and our local neighborhoods. We prioritize growth and development, encouraging teammates to expand their careers locally or within our broader medical group and fostering professional and community impact.

Rewards and Benefits:

  • Compensation: Competitive compensation package with additional bonuses.
  • Benefits:
    • Comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, life, and AD&D insurance.
    • Long- and short-term disability coverage.
    • 401(k) with matching contributions.
    • Paid medical malpractice insurance with tail coverage.
    • Annual CME allowance to support ongoing education.
